intro: Bumelia pleistochasia, commonly known as the Mexican buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by bright red berries that are a source of food for various wildlife species. Bumelia pleistochasia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
